member.name: T:GSF.COMTRADE.Parser
member.summary: COMTRADE data file(s) parser.

member.name: M:GSF.COMTRADE.Parser.Finalize
member.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources before the object is reclaimed by .

member.name: P:GSF.COMTRADE.Parser.Schema
member.summary: Gets or sets associated COMTRADE schema for this .
member.remarks: Upon assignment, any value will be used to initialize the parser's initial property when an associated data file that ends with ".cff", ".dat" or ".d00" is found to exist.

member.name: P:GSF.COMTRADE.Parser.FileName
member.summary: Gets or sets COMTRADE data filename. If there are more than one data files in a set, this should be set to first file name in the set, e.g., DATA123.D00.

member.name: P:GSF.COMTRADE.Parser.IsCombinedFileFormat
member.summary: Gets flag that determines if is a Combined File Format (.cff) file.

member.name: P:GSF.COMTRADE.Parser.BinaryByteCount
member.summary: Gets the byte count as parsed from a Combined File Format (.cff) file targeted with binary format.

member.name: P:GSF.COMTRADE.Parser.InferTimeFromSampleRates
member.summary: Gets or sets flag that determines if time should be inferred from sample rates.

member.name: P:GSF.COMTRADE.Parser.Timestamp
member.summary: Gets timestamp of current record.

member.name: P:GSF.COMTRADE.Parser.Values
member.summary: Gets values of current record.

member.name: P:GSF.COMTRADE.Parser.PrimaryValues
member.summary: Gets values of current record with secondary analog channels scaled to primary values.

member.name: P:GSF.COMTRADE.Parser.SecondaryValues
member.summary: Gets values of current record with primary analog channels scaled to secondary values.

member.name: P:GSF.COMTRADE.Parser.AdjustToUTC
member.summary: Gets or sets flag that determines if schemas that include a time code for a UTC offset should apply the adjustment so that timestamps are parsed as UTC.

member.name: P:GSF.COMTRADE.Parser.TargetAngleUnit
member.summary: Gets or sets target angle unit for any analog channels that are angles.
member.remarks: When assigned, any encountered angles will be converted to the specified unit while parsing.

member.name: M:GSF.COMTRADE.Parser.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all the resources used by the object.

member.name: M:GSF.COMTRADE.Parser.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the object and optionally releases the managed resources.
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:GSF.COMTRADE.Parser.OpenFiles
member.summary: Opens all COMTRADE data file streams.

member.name: M:GSF.COMTRADE.Parser.CloseFiles
member.summary: Closes all COMTRADE data file streams.

member.name: M:GSF.COMTRADE.Parser.ReadNext
member.summary: Reads next COMTRADE record.
member.returns: true if read succeeded; otherwise, false if end of data set was reached.

member.summary: Creates a new instance of the from an existing configuration file name.
member.param: File name of configuration file to parse.
Indicates whether to relax validation on the number of line image elements.

member.name: P:GSF.COMTRADE.Schema.FileName
member.summary: Gets the file name used to generate this schema when constructed with one; otherwise, null.

member.summary: Gets flag that determines if is a Combined File Format (.cff) file.

member.summary: Gets or sets free-form station name for this .

member.summary: Gets or sets free-form device ID for this .

member.summary: Gets or sets version number of the IEEE Std C37.111 used by this .

member.summary: Gets total number of analog and digital channels of this .

member.summary: Gets total number of analog channels of this .

member.summary: Gets total number of digital channels of this .

member.summary: Gets or sets analog channels of this .

member.name: P:GSF.COMTRADE.Schema.DigitalChannels
member.summary: Gets or sets digital channels of this .

member.name: P:GSF.COMTRADE.Schema.NominalFrequency
member.summary: Gets or sets nominal frequency of this .

member.name: P:GSF.COMTRADE.Schema.SampleRates
member.summary: Gets or sets sampling rates of this . A file of phasor data will normally be made using a single sampling rate, so this will usually be 1.

member.name: P:GSF.COMTRADE.Schema.TotalSampleRates
member.summary: Gets total number of sample rates of this .

member.name: P:GSF.COMTRADE.Schema.TotalSamples
member.summary: Gets total number of samples, i.e., rows per timestamp, as reported by the sample rates.

member.name: P:GSF.COMTRADE.Schema.TotalChannelValues
member.summary: Gets total number of channels values, i.e., TotalChannels * TotalSamples.

member.name: P:GSF.COMTRADE.Schema.StartTime
member.summary: Gets or sets start timestamp of this .

member.name: P:GSF.COMTRADE.Schema.TriggerTime
member.summary: Gets or sets trigger timestamp of this .

member.name: P:GSF.COMTRADE.Schema.FileType
member.summary: Gets or sets file type of this .

member.name: P:GSF.COMTRADE.Schema.TimeFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the multiplication factor for the time differential (timestamp) field in this .

member.name: P:GSF.COMTRADE.Schema.TimeCode
member.summary: Gets or sets UTC offset for channel timestamps - format HhMM.

member.name: P:GSF.COMTRADE.Schema.LocalCode
member.summary: Gets or sets UTC offset for timezone of recording device, or "x" for not applicable - format HhMM.

member.name: P:GSF.COMTRADE.Schema.TimeQualityIndicatorCode
member.summary: Gets or sets the time quality indicator code for the recorded data set.

member.name: P:GSF.COMTRADE.Schema.LeapSecondIndicator
member.summary: Gets or sets the leap second indicator for the recorded data set.

member.name: P:GSF.COMTRADE.Schema.DigitalWords
member.summary: Gets the total digital words for given number of digital values when the file type is binary.

member.summary: Calculates the size of a record, in bytes, when the file type is binary.

member.name: T:GSF.COMTRADE.Writer
member.summary: COMTRADE data and config file writer.

member.name: F:GSF.COMTRADE.Writer.MaxFileSize
member.summary: Defines the maximum file size for this COMTRADE implementation.
member.remarks: Value represents 256TB, arbitrarily chosen extreme maximum file size.

member.name: M:GSF.COMTRADE.Writer.CreateSchema(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{GSF.COMTRADE.ChannelMetadata},System.String,System.String,GSF.Ticks,System.Int32,System.Int32,GSF.COMTRADE.FileType,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new COMTRADE configuration .
member.param: Total data samples (i.e., total number of rows).
Determines the data file type for the schema.
Time factor to use in schema - defaults to 1000.
Determines if the FRACSEC word digital definitions should be included - defaults to true.

remarks.para: This function is primarily intended to create a configuration based on synchrophasor data (see Annex H: Schema for Phasor Data 2150 Using the COMTRADE File Standard in IEEE C37.111-2010), it may be necessary to manually create a schema object for other COMTRADE needs. You can call the property to return a string that can be written to a file that will be the contents of the configuration file.

Linear scaling factors for analog channels, i.e., adders and multipliers, will be set to reasonable values based on the channel type. These should be adjusted as needed based on actual channel value ranges. Note that for the multiplier will be 1.0 and the adder will be 0.0 for all analog values.

member.name: M:GSF.COMTRADE.Writer.CreateSchema(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{GSF.COMTRADE.ChannelMetadata},System.String,System.String,GSF.Ticks,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new COMTRADE configuration .
member.param: Total data samples (i.e., total number of rows).
Determines if data file should be binary or ASCII - defaults to true for binary.
Time factor to use in schema - defaults to 1000.
Determines if the FRACSEC word digital definitions should be included - defaults to true.
member.remarks: This function is primarily intended to create a configuration based on synchrophasor data (see Annex H: Schema for Phasor Data 2150 Using the COMTRADE File Standard in IEEE C37.111-2010), it may be necessary to manually create a schema object for other COMTRADE needs. You can call the property to return a string that can be written to a file that will be the contents of the configuration file.

member.name: M:GSF.COMTRADE.Writer.CreateCFFStream(System.String,GSF.COMTRADE.Schema,System.String[],System.String[],System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Creates a new Combined File Format (.cff) COMTRADE file stream.
member.param: Target file name. Must have ".cff" extension.
Lines of "INF" section to write to stream, if any.
Lines of "HDR" section to write to stream, if any.
Target encoding; null value will default to UTF-8 (no BOM).
member.returns: New file stream for Combined File Format (.cff) COMTRADE file, ready to write at data section.

member.name: M:GSF.COMTRADE.Writer.CreateCFFStreamAscii(System.String,GSF.COMTRADE.Schema,System.String[],System.String[],System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Creates a new Combined File Format (.cff) COMTRADE file stream targeted for ASCII.
member.param: Target file name. Must have ".cff" extension.
Lines of "INF" section to write to stream, if any.
Lines of "HDR" section to write to stream, if any.
Target encoding; null value will default to UTF-8 (no BOM).
member.returns: New stream writer for Combined File Format (.cff) COMTRADE file, ready to write at data section.
member.remarks: For COMTRADE versions greater than 2001, any use of the term ASCII also inherently implies Unicode UTF-8. When then parameter is null, the default, UTF-8 encoding will be used for text writes. If ASCII encoding needs to be enforced for backwards compatibility reasons, then the parameter will need to be set to .

member.name: M:GSF.COMTRADE.Writer.UpdateCFFStreamBinaryByteCount(System.IO.Stream,System.Int64,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Updates a Combined File Format (.cff) COMTRADE file stream with a final binary byte count.
member.param: Target encoding; null value will default to UTF-8 (no BOM).

member.name: M:GSF.COMTRADE.Writer.WriteNextRecordAscii(System.IO.StreamWriter,GSF.COMTRADE.Schema,GSF.Ticks,System.Double[],System.UInt32,System.Boolean,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Writes next COMTRADE record in ASCII format.
member.param: Values to write - 16-bit digitals should exist as a word in an individual double value, method will write out bits.
Determines if FRACSEC value should be automatically injected into stream as first digital - defaults to true.
FRACSEC value to inject into output stream - defaults to 0x0000.
member.remarks: This function is primarily intended to write COMTRADE ASCII data records based on synchrophasor data (see Annex H: Schema for Phasor Data 2150 Using the COMTRADE File Standard in IEEE C37.111-2010), it may be necessary to manually write records for other COMTRADE needs (e.g., non 16-bit digitals).

member.name: M:GSF.COMTRADE.Writer.WriteNextRecordBinary(System.IO.Stream,GSF.COMTRADE.Schema,GSF.Ticks,System.Double[],System.UInt32,System.Boolean,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Writes next COMTRADE record in binary format.
member.param: Values to write - 16-bit digitals should exist as a word in an individual double value.
Determines if FRACSEC value should be automatically injected into stream as first digital - defaults to true.
FRACSEC value to inject into output stream - defaults to 0x0000.
member.remarks: This function is primarily intended to write COMTRADE binary data records based on synchrophasor data (see Annex H: Schema for Phasor Data 2150 Using the COMTRADE File Standard in IEEE C37.111-2010), it may be necessary to manually write records for other COMTRADE needs (e.g., non 16-bit digitals).

member.name: M:GSF.COMTRADE.Writer.WriteNextRecordBinary32(System.IO.Stream,GSF.COMTRADE.Schema,GSF.Ticks,System.Double[],System.UInt32,System.Boolean,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Writes next COMTRADE record in binary32 format.
member.param: Values to write - 16-bit digitals should exist as a word in an individual double value.
Determines if FRACSEC value should be automatically injected into stream as first digital - defaults to true.
FRACSEC value to inject into output stream - defaults to 0x0000.
member.remarks: This function is primarily intended to write COMTRADE binary32 data records based on synchrophasor data (see Annex H: Schema for Phasor Data 2150 Using the COMTRADE File Standard in IEEE C37.111-2010), it may be necessary to manually write records for other COMTRADE needs (e.g., non 16-bit digitals).

member.name: M:GSF.COMTRADE.Writer.WriteNextRecordFloat32(System.IO.Stream,GSF.COMTRADE.Schema,GSF.Ticks,System.Double[],System.UInt32,System.Boolean,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Writes next COMTRADE record in float32 format.
member.param: Values to write - 16-bit digitals should exist as a word in an individual double value.
Determines if FRACSEC value should be automatically injected into stream as first digital - defaults to true.
FRACSEC value to inject into output stream - defaults to 0x0000.
member.remarks: This function is primarily intended to write COMTRADE float32 data records based on synchrophasor data (see Annex H: Schema for Phasor Data 2150 Using the COMTRADE File Standard in IEEE C37.111-2010), it may be necessary to manually write records for other COMTRADE needs (e.g., non 16-bit digitals).

member.name: M:GSF.COMTRADE.Writer.WriteNextRecordAscii(System.IO.StreamWriter,GSF.COMTRADE.Schema,GSF.Ticks,System.Double[],System.Boolean[],System.UInt32,System.Boolean,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Writes next COMTRADE record in ASCII format.
member.param: Values to write for analog channels.
Values to write for digital channels.
Determines if FRACSEC value should be automatically injected into stream as first digital - defaults to false.
FRACSEC value to inject into output stream - defaults to 0x0000.
member.remarks: This function is primarily intended to write COMTRADE ASCII data records based on synchrophasor data (see Annex H: Schema for Phasor Data 2150 Using the COMTRADE File Standard in IEEE C37.111-2010), it may be necessary to manually write records for other COMTRADE needs (e.g., non 16-bit digitals).

member.name: M:GSF.COMTRADE.Writer.WriteNextRecordBinary(System.IO.Stream,GSF.COMTRADE.Schema,GSF.Ticks,System.Double[],System.Boolean[],System.UInt32,System.Boolean,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Writes next COMTRADE record in binary format.
member.param: Values to write for analog channels.
Values to write for digital channels.
Determines if FRACSEC value should be automatically injected into stream as first digital - defaults to false.
FRACSEC value to inject into output stream - defaults to 0x0000.
member.remarks: This function is primarily intended to write COMTRADE binary data records based on synchrophasor data (see Annex H: Schema for Phasor Data 2150 Using the COMTRADE File Standard in IEEE C37.111-2010), it may be necessary to manually write records for other COMTRADE needs (e.g., non 16-bit digitals).
